We attended a number of flooding incidents overnight, as rain continues  today please only travel if it‚Äôs essential üåß‚ö†Ô∏è

Check @metoffice & @EnvAgencyYNE for updates https://t.co/hPjAHP7dk6

@theyorkmix Surprised we haven't seen that (decades old) fence replaced with a low wall by now tbh, cheaper than repeated flood damage and this stretch is always vulnerable.

Maybe we could have something planned? @CityofYork @EnvAgencyYNE
@andyscargill @BBCNWT @ShitChester @GPorterStandard @EnvAgencyNW Hi Andy. Looks like we might be speaking a lot today. Could we please use these in our coverage? Happy to credit your photo

text: RT @anna69wallo: More pictures of #floods #RiverDerwent #norton looks like Church Street may need to close! Kink in pump on Church St! @Yor‚Ä¶

I'm also thankful that thousands of properties have been protected by #TeamEA defences. 

@EnvAgency teams are continuing to work 24/7 - operating barriers, clearing grilles, issuing warnings and supporting other emergency responders. My sincerest thanks to everyone involved. https://t.co/Wc8fiBoZMz

My thoughts are with those who've sadly already been affected by #StormChristoph and the flooding this week.

Each flooded home and business is a personal tragedy, and the @EnvAgency will keep working for as long as it takes to help those communities recover.

text: @charlotte2153 @EnvAgencyNW 24 hours in 5 phone calls and still no sand bags provided, no closed road signs..year in year out this happens and we have had about enough. No preventive measures in place ever for home owners, where is the help before it gets in your home.!!! https://t.co/8FOkvQgW08

A big thank you to our teams from @gmpolice, @manchesterfire, @ManCityCouncil & @EnvAgency who worked through the night to keep people safe.

Well done to the local community for supporting them. üëèüëè

It was a close run thing & the danger‚Äôs not yet averted. Please stay vigilant. https://t.co/Rk1BipTQiL
